page.title: 17Tourism
page.content: The{Peak National Park}is a popular area for tourists and our area is surrounded by centres such as Castleton and Buxton where there are both long and short stay visitors. In this area the main holiday activity is{hiking.}One very well used route brings walkers in from Castleton and then down the dales to Miller's Dale. There are Youth Hostels at both these places. Other activities nearby include caving, climbing, natural history and general sightseeing. Traffic of many nationalities passes along the main A 623.{Accomodation}is to be found in the Devonshire Arms, in several houses offering Bed and Breakfast and in a number of rented cottages used for holidays. There are no camping or caravan sites.
